page.title: 03A WALK NEAR ASTWOOD BANK-2
page.content: At the end of the field there is a small stream which you have to cross, but this soon disappears.In the past,if a farmer had a stream in his field, he would plant a hedge along-side. You continue walking south and the hills build up gently.You climb over a gate and walk along a mud track.This soon finishes and you come to the Saltway.This was a road going back to Roman times,when Droitwich was an important town for salt.Evesham, Pershore and Worcester were all market centres because of better farming.We soon came to Sambourne. Most of the woodland has been cut down in Sambourne to make space for housing.
